hero.description: A simple way to explore and compare computer science curricula from top universities. Find the right classes for your learning journey in one searchable index.

mission.label: Project Overview
mission.desc_1: CodeCampus is a student-focused project that gathers public course catalogs from top schools like MIT, Stanford, and Berkeley into one easy-to-use search tool.
mission.desc_2: We don't host the classes. Instead, we organize scattered info—like what you need to know before joining and how hard a course is—to help you plan your own studies.

universal_index.title: Universal Index
universal_index.desc: Access a normalized, query-optimized registry of courses from MIT, Stanford, Berkeley, and CMU via a single, latency-free control plane.

progress_analytics.title: Progress Telemetry
progress_analytics.desc: Track your intellectual velocity. Log coursework to generate real-time visualizations of your credit distribution and domain expertise.

gap_analysis.title: Skill Audit
gap_analysis.desc: Algorithmic comparison of your transcript against top-tier degree requirements. Detect prerequisite voids and optimize your learning vector.

pricing.label: Membership
pricing.desc: Choose the level of insight that fits your academic goals.

free.name: Scholar
free.desc: Essential tools for finding and tracking courses.

pro.name: Fellow
pro.desc: Advanced analytics for serious academic planning.
